string_data:
Looking at my previous output, I can identify one mistake:

In the subtitle, I tagged "say they are shocked at the punishment" as disruption effects (#DS #DE), but this is actually describing the family's reaction/comment about the punishment, not the disruption effects of the protest itself. The punishment (sentencing) could be considered a knock-on disruption effect, but the family's shock about it is their reaction, not the disruption effect itself.

Here is the corrected output:

ID: The-Times_2024-07-27_Mum-got-four-years
Source: The-Times
Title: Mum got four years for renting a safehouse for Just Stop Oil
Subtitle: The family of Louise Lancaster, #DS who was sentenced this month for her role in the M25 protests, #DE say they are shocked at the punishment but back her fight against climate change
Content: #PH #CS The family of Just Stop Oil protester Louise Lancaster, from left: son Theo, Jonny Ainslie, fiancé to daughter Verity, ex-husband Tim, and son Tristan (Alt: This family portrait shows five people posed outdoors in a green, natural setting by water. From left: a young man in a dark checkered shirt, a person in a green shirt and red shorts, a woman in a light blue top, an older man in a grey shirt, and a tall man in a brown patterned shirt standing behind the group. They're positioned on grassy ground with trees and foliage visible in the background.) #CE
#DS Louise Lancaster, a 58-year-old former special educational needs co-ordinator, has been sentenced to four years in prison for her role in the M25 protests that caused "massive disruption" over four days in November 2022. #DE Her family describes her as "unrelentingly kind" and someone who "listens more than she speaks," expressing shock at the sentence length while backing her climate activism.#DS Lancaster was one of five co-conspirators who attended a Zoom meeting to plan recruiting 45 volunteers to climb gantries over the M25. #DE #MS Her former husband Tim explains that Louise, who studied maths at Oxford, had previously tried conventional activism - marches, petitions, writing to MPs - but concluded "we did all of that and nothing changed — we have to do something else." #ME He describes how difficult the decision was for someone who worried about inconveniencing people: #MS "She wouldn't have done it if she'd been able to see another way." #ME #DS The protest impacted around 700,000 vehicles, allegedly cost the Met Police £1.1m, and caused missed exams, funerals and cancer appointments, leaving the motorway "compromised" for more than 120 hours. Lancaster did not herself take part in the November protest, but she paid more than £1,000 to rent the Airbnb where protesters stayed and bought climbing equipment. She had previously climbed a gantry on the M25 in July 2022. #DE
#DS #PH #CS The organisers of the protest, jailed earlier this month, from left: Lucia Whittaker De Abreu, Cressida Gethin, Louise Lancaster, Daniel Shaw, and Extinction Rebellion and Just Stop Oil co-founder Roger Hallam (Alt: Five people stand arm-in-arm, smiling at the camera in front of a stone church building with flint walls. From left: a woman in a patterned dress, a young woman in a blue checkered shirt, an older woman with grey hair in a floral top, a man with curly hair in a dark shirt, and an older bearded man in a red plaid shirt holding a walking stick.) #CE #DE
#DS #MS On the Zoom call, Roger Hallam, co-founder of Just Stop Oil, said they intended to cause "the biggest disruption in British modern history" to force the government to end new oil and gas exploration in the North Sea. #ME #DE #NS Judge Christopher Hehir said Lancaster and her co-conspirators had "crossed the line from concerned campaigner to fanatic." #NE #DS Hallam was jailed for five years, while Lancaster received four years along with Daniel Shaw, 38, Lucia Whittaker De Abreu, 35, and Cressida Gethin, 22. #DE Her son Theo says she knew the risks: "if we'd said, 'Mum, don't do it,' she wouldn't have taken part."
#DS #PH #CS Just Stop Oil protests at the M25 over four days in November 2022 caused "massive disruption", the judge said (Alt: The image shows a closed section of the M25 motorway with multiple police vehicles and officers in high-visibility jackets gathered on the empty road. An overhead electronic sign displays ) #CE #DE
